intro: Salicornia amplexicaulis, commonly known as sea beans or glassworts, is a halophyte plant adapted to saline environments. It is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae, characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and estuaries where it thrives in high-salinity conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or red, and it produces tiny seeds that are dispersed by wind. Salicornia amplexicaulis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various organisms.
